company.name: Time Warner Cable Inc.
company.business_description: Time Warner Cable provides video, high-speed data, digital telephone, and other telecommunications and cable services.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. ยง 45(a); Section 615 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. ยง 1681m; Risk-Based Pricing Rule, 16 C.F.R. ยง 640.1 et seq.

complaint.factual_background: Time Warner Cable (TWC) extended credit to consumers for cable television, high-speed internet, and telephone services. When reviewing service applications, TWC retrieved consumers' credit reports and required some prospective customers with less favorable credit histories to pay a deposit or first month's bill in advance. From January 1, 2011 through at least March 5, 2013, TWC failed to provide required risk-based pricing notices to consumers who were required to pay deposits based on their credit reports, in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act's Risk-Based Pricing Rule.

counts.title: Violation of the Risk-Based Pricing Rule
counts.representation: TWC extended credit to consumers on material terms that are materially less favorable than the most favorable material terms available to a substantial proportion of its customers, based in whole or in part on its use of consumer reports
counts.fact: In numerous instances, TWC failed to provide notice to consumers that they were extended credit on material terms that are materially less favorable than the most favorable material terms available to a substantial proportion of TWC's customers
counts.conclusion: Failure to provide such notice to a consumer constitutes a violation of the Risk-Based Pricing Rule.
